workflow.name: Poll multiple Gmail accounts with unified data table storage & Discord notifications
workflow.description:
![Screenshot 20251216 001014.png](fileId:3669)

This template lets you poll multiple Gmail accounts from a single workflow using n8n‚Äôs credential-aware execution. Instead of creating separate workflows for every inbox, this setup loops through all accounts stored in your data table and runs Gmail operations dynamically using the correct OAuth2 credential.

It‚Äôs built for cases like *cold-email systems, multi-client mail monitoring*, or anything that needs centralized polling and logging.

## ### What It Does

1. Pulls all email account records from the cold_email_accounts table.

2. For every account, the workflow:

3. Runs the Gmail ‚ÄúGet Many Messages‚Äù node for that account using "Run Node With Credentials X" community node.


4. Messages are reformatted into a clean JSON object (from, subject, preview text, body, labels, attachments, etc.).

5. Saved into the All Emails table using an upsert (avoids duplicates).

6. Sends a Discord notification like ‚Äú15 new emails arrived‚Äù.

## ### How to Set It Up

1. Create Gmail OAuth2 credentials in n8n, one for each email account you want to poll.

2. Add those credentials into a Data Table named cold_email_accounts with columns:
cred_id
credentials_name
email
last_polled (datetime)

3. Import this workflow template into n8n.

4. Update:
DataTable references (if your names/IDs differ)
Discord channel/server IDs
Any domain filters inside the Gmail search query

5. Activate the workflow and it will automatically:
Poll each Gmail inbox every hour
Save all new emails
Notify you on Discord
Keep everything synced via last_polled.

parameters.jsCode:
let last_polled = $json.last_polled;

const last_poll = Math.floor(new Date(last_polled).getTime() / 1000); // epoch seconds
const now = Math.floor(Date.now() / 1000); // epoch seconds

let item = $json
item.after = last_poll
item.before = now

return {item}

parameters.content:
### How It Works (node-by-node):

1. Schedule Trigger fires every hour (or your preferred interval).

2. Fetch all email account rows from the cold_email_accounts table.

3. Split In Batches loops through each account one by one.

4. Calculate poll window in a Code node (after = last_polled, before = now)

5. Run Node With Credentials X:
Injects that account‚Äôs Gmail OAuth2 credential
Executes Gmail ‚Üí Get Many Messages
Uses filtered query:
after:<timestamp> before:<timestamp>

6. If messages exist: Format + clean them through a Code node

7. Save to All Emails table

8. Update last_polled

8. If no messages: Skip saving

9. Only update last_polled

10. Once the loop finishes:

11. Check how many rows were inserted into the All Emails table during this run

12. Send a Discord message summarizing the count (ex: ‚Äú15 new emails arrived‚Äù).

## Get Email Accounts
Loads all email accounts to be polled.

## Polling Time Calculator
Calculates the polling time range in Epoch.

## Get Gmail Messages Dynamically
Runs Gmail nodes dynamically using OAuth credentials from the data table.

## Add to Data Tables
Upserts new emails into the All Emails table and avoids duplicates.
Updates last_polled for the current email account after processing.

## Send Notification on Discord Channel
Sends a summary message with the number of newly received emails.

user.name: Jatin Khatri
user.bio: Building high-end agents and systems for businesses around the world.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
